name: Selling PDFs the Easy Way - An instructional guide to selling PDF patterns, ebooks and more
description:
So you are thinking about diversifying in to digital publishing but don’t know where to start? If you are just beginning your journey the learning curve can be very steep. Often the research involved in finding out how and where to sell your product, how to market it and even how to go about just creating it can just be so extensive that you lose interest in the whole original idea altogether!

"This book contains all the
information and advice that would have saved me
months and months of delays and procrastination!”

I’ve tried to share very practical and specific information that can get you started creating and selling your products without delay. I specifically focused on critiquing and comparing digital delivery platforms as this was one of the most confusing aspects for me when I started.

I’m sure you’ll find this eBook a valuable resource that will answer many of your questions and get you started successfully on your digital publishing journey. And if you are already selling digital products, I guarantee that you will pick up some valuable tips to create and deliver your product more efficiently.

Contains information on:

Why you should sell digital product and why PDFs may be suitable for you.

How to create your content, including software you can use, design tips and practical how to's

Choices for digital delivery and a table comparing popular platforms

Advice on pricing, SEO and marketing your products

Interviews with 5 successful crafters and bloggers that have successfully taken their businesses to the next level via selling PDF digital content.

Some printable work sheets to get you started

...and much more. 

44 pages of really practical content that will get you started straight away.

View on any device that supports PDF including, computer, e-readers, smartphones and tablets like iPad

(4.9MB PDF)

name: Felt Hexagon Rug PDF Pattern & Instructions
description:
By popular demand, the pattern and instructions for this jaw dropping rug is now available. Originally created as a bespoke piece for my daughter Emma's room, as seen in Homespun Magazine and Apartment Therapy.

This colourful woollen rug is the perfect project to upcycle all those old jumpers and blankets that are cluttering your wardrobe. You can create a rainbow rug like I have, or choose muted tones for a more organic look. 

This pattern includes full size printable pattern templates, sewing instructions (with diagrams for the tricky bits), care instructions and handy directions for making your own felt from unwanted knitwear and old blankets.

Only some basic hand stitching skills required (running stitch & whip stitch) so is suitable for all skill levels. 
Finished size 168 x 210cm (66 x 82 3/4in)


View the PDF file on your computer or ipad (via ibooks)

The e-pattern is an automatic download and a secure link will be emailed directly to your inbox. Please ensure your paypal email address is active.
There is no shipping charge on this product.

name: Felt Owl PDF Pattern & Instructions
description:
These cuddly owls make cheerful companions. They are ideal gifts for babies and toddlers as they have no buttons, small parts or adornments.
Make a whole Parliament of Owls in a rainbow of colours with up-cycled blankets or knitwear.

This pattern includes full size printable pattern templates, sewing instructions (with diagrams for the tricky bits), and handy directions for making your own felt from unwanted knitwear and old blankets. 

Recommended minimum skill level: confident beginners

Finished project size 23cm x 16cm x 7cm (9" x 6" x 2 .75")

Materials and equipment requirements 
assorted coloured wool felt or felted knitwear 
polyester or wool filling
sewing thread to match felt colours 
Printer, tracing paper & pencil
sewing machine
general sewing supplies

View the PDF file on your computer or ipad (via ibooks)

The E-book is an automatic download and a secure link will be emailed directly to your inbox. Please ensure your paypal email address is active.
There is no shipping charge on this product.

name: Six Baby Gifts to make with Fabric Scraps E-Book
description:
In this e-book I’ve designed and clearly illustrated six projects that make ideal baby gifts, and can be made in just a few hours. 

Many, like the scrappy chandelier mobile or fabric covered hangers, can translate to adult gifts as well depending on the fabric combinations you use.

If you are like me and love to sew, you may find yourself accumulating a large collection of fabric scraps. It can be tempting to just throw them away, especially when most sewing projects require larger fabric pieces, but please don’t. Sewing with scraps can be a wonderful experience that requires a little creativity and patience, but the results are truly satisfying.

Includes 6 original projects designed for sewers of all levels. 
All of these projects are suitable for beginner sewers, with more challenging techniques clearly explained and illustrated.

Projects:
Scrappy Ball
Scrappy Bunny Rattle 
Scrappy Chandelier Mobile 
Fabric Covered Hangers 
Scrappy Bib
Jigsaw Quilt

Printable templates included.

View the PDF file on your computer or ipad (via ibooks)

The E-book is an automatic download and a secure link will be emailed directly to your inbox. Please ensure your paypal email address is active.
There is no shipping charge on this product.

name: The Craft of Markets: How to achieve market stall success E-Book
description:
So you’ve decided that maybe you’d like to run your own craft market stall…lots of fun, but lots of hard work as well.
 
This e-book will help you make better choices about what market strategy is right for you. Whether you are just wanting to earn a few extra dollars or use markets as a stepping stone into something much bigger.

Learn all the tips and tricks to having a successful and profitable market stall with a minimum amount of stress and a maximum amount of fun!

Full of practical, honest advice and some important questions every prospective stall holder needs to ask themselves before they commit to the world of markets.

Includes sections on Picking the right market for you, Market applications, Products, Pricing, Merchandising Logistics, a handy printable Essentials checklist and a Resources guide with links to packaging and display item stockists and more…
 
Written by Cintia Gonzalez of My Poppet and Jodie Maloni from The Haby Goddess, who between them have over 10 years of market experience, and many more in both bricks & mortar and online retail. With some extra handy hints from some market organisers.

This is a digital product that comes in a PDF format that you can load on your iPad or mobile device, read on your computer or even print out. 
There is no shipping charge - you will be emailed a secure link to download this product. Please check your paypal email or spam folder if it hasn't arrived shortly after your order is placed.
